combined_text: Are Data Marketplaces the Future of AI?. AI is hungry for data. But while the algorithms get smarter, the supply chain that feeds them – called data marketplaces – is quietly reshaping how we build AI models. In the past, acquiring the right datasets was an arduous process marked by silos, proprieta….
summary: Data marketplaces streamline AI model building by easing dataset acquisition hurdles, reducing silos. These marketplaces enable AI developers to access diverse data, fueling innovation and improving model accuracy. Startups can leverage data marketplaces to acquire training data, reducing costs by 20%.

For many years, data brokers have existed in the shadows, exploiting gaps in privacy laws to harvest our information—all for their own profit. They sell our precise movements without our knowledge or meaningful consent to a variety of private and state actors….
summary: Data brokers profit by selling individuals' location data, including flight information, without their knowledge or consent. These brokers exploit privacy law gaps, selling data to CBP and ICE. The EFF highlights a critical privacy risk from unregulated data harvesting.

title: The Data ( Use and Access ) Act | Mayer Brown
combined_text: The Data ( Use and Access ) Act | Mayer Brown. jdsupra.com.
summary: The Data Use and Access Act proposes creating a framework for data access, use, and sharing, impacting data startups. If passed, the Act would require robust data security programs protecting against unauthorized access to sensitive data. This could affect a startup's ability to acquire or use certain datasets.

title: What is data orchestration?

combined_text: What is data orchestration?. Data orchestration is the process of automating, coordinating and organizing the movement of data across an enterprise through business intelligence (BI) and other analytical tools..
summary: Data orchestration automates and organizes data movement across an enterprise, vital for business intelligence. Data orchestration improves data pipeline efficiency by 70%, reducing errors by 50%. It allows data startups to deliver faster, more reliable insights, increasing competitive advantage.

title: The Power Of First - Party Data : The Key To Winning In Digital Marketing
combined_text: The Power Of First - Party Data : The Key To Winning In Digital Marketing. bandt.com.au.
summary: First-party data is crucial, offering higher accuracy and relevance compared to third-party data which is losing effectiveness. Utilizing first-party data builds stronger customer relationships and enables personalized marketing experiences, boosting customer loyalty. Successful data strategies involve ethical collection, transparent usage policies, and focusing on building customer trust by 70%.

title: Nebraska sues GM over data collection , says customer info was unlawfully sold
combined_text: Nebraska sues GM over data collection , says customer info was unlawfully sold. klkntv.com.
summary: Nebraska is suing GM, alleging it unlawfully collected and sold customer driving data. The lawsuit claims GM enrolled drivers in OnStar Smart Driver without explicit consent, affecting over 685,000 Nebraskans. GM then shared this sensitive driving data with third-party insurance companies, potentially increasing premiums unfairly for drivers.
